availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Edmund S. Bailey (Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace)

body.p: Franklin County, Kentucky, farmer and justice of the peace. Buckingham County, Virginia, native. Married to Sarah Bailey. Father of Mary J. Bailey, William J. Bailey, Dennis F. Bailey, Clemson B. Bailey, Romulus L. Bailey, Americus A. Bailey, Lawrence G. Bailey, and Edmund Bailey. Married to Mary Gordon Bailey in Franklin County, Kentucky, in December 1856. Father of William Bailey. Farmer in Franklin County in 1850. Farmer in Franklin County in 1860. Owned nine enslaved persons in Franklin County in 1860. Justice of the Peace in Franklin County from December 9, 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 104A.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 371.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, District 2, p. 509A.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Franklin County, Bald Knob Precinct, p. 9A.
Kentucky Birth, Marriage and Death Records (1852-1910), KDLA, Frankfort, KY, Roll #994034, Franklin County Marriages.
"Edmund S. Bailey (1801-1886)," Find A Grave, Memorial #1374254, accessed September 19, 2021, http://www.findagrave.com/memorial/1374254.
